text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Admission to the Bar" means, unless the context requires otherwise, authorization by the Court of Appeals to practice law in the State.
"Attorney at law" means a lawyer who, while practicing law, represents another person.
"Bar" means, unless the context requires otherwise, the Bar of the Court of Appeals of Maryland.
"Board" means the State Board of Law Examiners.

section.section:
"Court" does not include:
an orphans' court; or
the Maryland Tax Court.

text.section: "Lawyer" means an individual who is admitted to the Bar.

section.section:
"Practice law" means to engage in any of the following activities:
giving legal advice;
representing another person before a unit of the State government or of a political subdivision; or
performing any other service that the Court of Appeals defines as practicing law.
